tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Ms. Chaplin is an excellent instructor. She is challenging, but helpful, kind and very reasonable. Be prepared with your medications, know the underlying disease process and mechanism of action for the medications, and have come prepared to learn!

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  TOUGH GRADER  RESPECTED
comments: I only had Ms. Chaplin for lecture. If you listen to her, you will pass the test. She tells you what you need to know. If you don\'t pass, you didn\'t put the time and effort in. She is tough, but she is fair. If there is something you feel you should have got credit for, talk to her and explain. She may just give you the points. Be prepared to work.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Big on patho and teaches that well at least.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: This is the best teacher I have ever had in the nursing department. She goes out of her way to make sure you understand the content. She is very helpful. She teaches the connections and is very fair. I didn\'t have her for clinical, but I am very fortunate I had her for lecture. I learned so much.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Ms. Chaplin is the best instructor Ive had so far. She doesnt come with a good reputation, but I honestly think its because she expects so much of her students! I learned so much from her, I feel prepared for last semester because of her. Shes big on pathophysiology- and rightfully so. She will prepare you well, if you allow her to!

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Ms. Chaplin is an awesome instructor. She takes the time to answer any questions you may have and she will explain things until you understand it. My favorite clinical so far. I learned a lot in her class and clinicals, she makes you think outside the box and how to truly be an advocate for your patient.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: This instructor is the one I remembered while taking NCLEX. She expected more from me than I expected from myself. You have to be prepared going into her lectures, she makes sure of it by asking many questions. Her reputation is why I chose to take her class...I love a challenge and that\'s exactly what I got. She is a true pt advocate! LOVED HER

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I think I can do better on my own. Study-study but when I get to class she makes me confused Speaking correctly is a challenge and not sure why but she seems to talk down to you at time. Don\'t have her for clinical. Class is enough

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Mrs Chaplin always seems to be in a pleasant mood. Her lectures and power points were ok but hard to follow. Her test were pretty difficult. They didn\'t treat the entire group fairly as in having study sessions and not inviting the other clinical groups. I was pretty upset about that. I did not have her for clinicals so no judgement there.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: People this is my 1st time ever rating a professor! I came to this class almost expecting to be unsuccessful bc her reputation precedes her. By far she is the BEST. My only regret is I didn\'t have her in clinical. I am totally convinced she makes the absolute best nurses. If you are lazy and not interested in being an excellent nurse.Don\'t take her

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Chaplin is an awesome instructor; I loved going to class, she has great passion for teaching and nursing. The material is difficult and you must read your IGGY. I also had her for clinical I grew so much under her guidance and if you are a serious student not looking to just get by; you will also love & appreciate hr. Nursing is serious be Serious

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: I thought after the worse class taught last semester this would be easy. WRONG! Scattered, all over the place and the tests don\'t make sense and reminds me of the horror of last semester. Don\'t think going to her office will help either. Don\'t take this class!!

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: Ms. Chaplin challenges you to do your very best. She expects a lot which made me expect the most from myself. I am so thankful I had her for both lecture and clinical. She makes the nurses you want to care for anyone you love.

tag_professor: Caring (3)  Inspirational (3)  Tough Grader (2)  Respected (2)  Participation matters (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)
comments: She is way to scatterbrained and way to much on her plate. She didn\'t really want to teach our class and didn\'t really care about us as students being in NUR 115

comments: Really enjoyed Ms Chaplain. Wonderful teacher & very interesting class. Highly recommend.

comments: Did NOT enjoy her, her teaching style, her test questions. She is scattered throughout her teaching, unorganized. Litton/Carson are better teachers within 210.
